programme.desc: In celebration of 30 years of the PDC World Darts Championship, take a look back at the very first tournament, a classic final from 2007 and one of the greatest legs ever played. Ep 1.

programme.title: The Taylor Years
programme.desc: Hear from the legendary Phil Taylor as the 16-time world champion recounts his glory years at the PDC World Darts Championship. Ep 2.

programme.desc: Follow John Part's PDC World Darts Championship journey from 2001 to 2008, a timespan in which the Canadian laid claim to three glorious triumphs. Ep 4.

programme.desc: Debuting in 2008 and bursting onto the scene in 2013 where he took the great Phil Taylor all the way, hear first-hand accounts of Michael Van Gerwen's incredible rise. Ep 5.

programme.title: Something Special: We're All Friends

programme.desc: Marie's mouth runs away with her, making her seem guilty of a crime. With something feeling off, can the McQueens work together to get to the bottom of it?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: An incriminating confession reveals a wolf in sheep's clothing. Mercedes is hot on Abe's tail. And a wife keeps close tabs on her husband.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The Burger Kitchen (Part 2): In the second half of a two-part Nightmare in LA, can Gordon Ramsay bring together the fragmented Saffron family and save their failing restaurant?

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Det. Dave Majors: Peralta is excited to work on a case with Dave Majors, the best detective in the NYPD, until Majors reveals that he intends to ask Santiago out.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Chopper: When Chief Madeline Wuntch allows Peralta to work on his dream case, a wary Captain Holt worries that she's setting the precinct up to fail.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Blonde Ambition and the Concept of Zero: Sheldon makes a terrifying mathematical discovery. And Mary is jealous of Missy's relationship with Mandy and Meemaw.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Resident Advisor and the Word 'Sketchy': Sheldon becomes a dorm resident advisor. Meemaw and Dale make a sketchy business deal.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Pancake Batter Anomaly: Penny volunteers to nurse Sheldon when he's sick. But his friends, who know how miserable he is when he's ill, stay well away.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Jerusalem Duality: Sheldon's confidence is shaken to the core by a 15-year-old physicist who is clearly much brighter than him.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Three Dinners: Phil and Claire take Haley out to dinner to discuss her future, but Haley manages to turn the tables.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Ispy: Claire and Phil decide to spy on Luke and Manny when they're hanging out with one of their more questionable friends.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: (2012) Quirky animated family comedy with the voices of Adam Sandler and Selena Gomez. Count Dracula runs a secluded hotel as a haven for monsters, but his daughter wants to see the world.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: Rude Tube's naughty little sister presents a man pretending to be a walrus, an incredible downhill bike run and some computer keyboard hurling.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Adhesive Duck Deficiency: Leonard, Raj and Howard go on a camping trip that alters their minds. Penny dislocates her shoulder when she slips in the shower.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Vengeance Formulation: Howard is scared about committing to Bernadette, so he avoids her. Then he realises that he's made a mistake and, to compensate, he proposes to her.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gorilla Experiment: Howard and Penny are both jealous when Bernadette becomes fascinated with Leonard's physics project.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Maternal Congruence: Leonard is horrified when his mother turns up unannounced for a Christmas visit, and then he finds out that Sheldon knew about her divorce before him.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Launch Party and a Whole Human Being: The Coopers can't be found as Mandy goes into labour, and Sheldon is excited about the launch of his database.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Teen Angst and a Smart-Boy Walk of Shame: Sheldon confronts the failure of his database, Georgie and Mandy struggle as new parents, and Missy feels forgotten.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Desperation Emanation: Leonard realises he's the only one of the gang with no girlfriend. Sheldon wants to get rid of his when she hatches a plan for him to meet her mother.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Irish Pub Formulation: A visit from Raj's sister Priya creates tension among the guys, especially when Leonard asks Sheldon to conceal his romantic past with her.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Apology Insufficiency: Leonard thinks his dating problems are due to a lack of confidence, and vows to be self-assured around attractive women. Howard is called by the FBI.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The 21-Second Excitation: The gang's plans to attend a film screening are scuppered by Sheldon's nemesis Wil Wheaton. Penny and Bernadette invite Amy to her first slumber party.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: It's the night before Christmas. There's a touching reunion at the McQueens' and Freddie confesses his true feelings. A festive party turns frosty, and a kind deed does more harm than good.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: It's Christmas Day, and the McQueens are happy for Mercedes when they catch Freddie trying to sneak out. Families come together in the village, but a chilling event stops the festivities...

programme.title: The Snowman
programme.desc: Raymond Briggs' classic animated tale of a little boy's snowman who comes to life and whisks him off to the North Pole for an adventure.

programme.title: The Snowman and the Snowdog
programme.desc: Charming animated sequel to Raymond Briggs' classic The Snowman. When a young boy and his mother move house, he builds a snowman and a snowdog who magically come to life.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: American Pie 2
programme.desc: (2001) Crude, still-coming-of-age comedy with Jason Biggs and Eugene Levy. The lads' shenanigans continue as they return from college to do it - or not - all again.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Xmas Party: It's the end of term and Will has been voted chairman of the Christmas prom committee, so he ropes in Simon, Jay and Neil to help get things organised.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Field Trip: It's a new term at Rudge Park comprehensive: time for the infamous sociology and geography field trip to Swanage...

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Work Experience: Jay arranges work experience for himself and Simon at his dad's company, but a mix-up leaves Neil at a newspaper and Will at a garage.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will's Birthday: Will plans a suitably grown-up dinner to celebrate his birthday, but his event clashes with a far more popular party, leaving his friends with a dilemma.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Ava: Jeffords asks Peralta to take care of his pregnant wife when she drops by at the precinct while he and Diaz are out seeking information on a murder case.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Wedding, Part 2: Wedding day chaos continues as the party shifts from one contingency plan to another. Guests start getting testy, and Mitchell and Cameron become discouraged.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Long Honeymoon: Summer has been blissful in the Dunphy house with Alex away and the family getting along. But when Alex returns home, the atmosphere immediately changes.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Do Not Push: A campus tour becomes an emotionally and psychologically charged experience for the Dunphys.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Express Christmas: The Pritchett clan decide to celebrate Christmas a little early so they split up to gather the holiday trappings as Mitchell, Alex and Lily hunt for a tree.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Old Man & the Tree: Jay takes Manny out to cut down a Christmas tree. Gloria is on edge with Mum in town, but changes her tune when she sees her bonding with Claire.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Johnny and Dora: Peralta and Santiago go undercover to catch Brooklyn's most notorious identity thief, but working together brings them closer than before.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: New Captain: After Holt is transferred to the NYPD Department of Public Relations, the arrival of a new captain causes chaos at the precinct.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: An Ugly Car, an Affair and Some Kickass Football: George Sr is asked to help with the football team. Mandy finds out about Georgie and Meemaw's secret business.

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Nerdvana Annihilation: Penny makes fun of Leonard's habit of collecting goofy memorabilia, but his friends kick up a fuss and try to keep him on the side of the nerds.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Feud: Phil's upset to lose his position of social chair to his nemesis Gil. When he learns that Luke is competing against Gil's kid at wrestling, it becomes a personal battle.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Spring-a-Ding-Fling: Cameron oversees the school's big spring dance, but when a popular teacher returns from sabbatical, a bit of not-so-friendly competition blooms.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Psychic Vortex: Sheldon and Raj go to a university party, where Raj lusts after a girl called Abby. Leonard regrets telling Penny he disapproves of her belief in psychics.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bus Pants Utilization: Leonard and Sheldon fight for control of an idea for an app.

programme.title: The Great Christmas Bake Off

programme.title: Peter Rabbit

programme.title: American Pie: The Wedding

programme.title: The Inbetweeners

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The Duke of Edinburgh Awards: Will is asked to co-ordinate the school's Duke of Edinburgh Award scheme and immediately turns the situation to his advantage.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners

programme.title: The Inbetweeners

programme.title: The Inbetweeners

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Yippie Kayak: Peralta, Boyle and Gina get into trouble while doing some shopping on Christmas Eve. Santiago tries to prove she's as tough as Holt and Diaz.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Hostage Situation: Boyle and Genevieve want to take their relationship to a new level, but his ex-wife Eleanor disrupts their plans. Can Peralta help them?

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: 9 Days: Captain Holt and Peralta contract mumps during an investigation, and decide to be quarantined together so they can use the time to solve the case.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Stolen Truck and Going on the Lam: Missy steals her dad's truck and hits the road with her friend Paige.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A German Folk Song and an Actual Adult: Georgie goes on a birthday date, and Sheldon takes an interest in Missy's favourite TV show.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Valloweaster: The squad competes in an effort to determine who is the greatest human/genius.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: (1987) Sci-fi thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. A US commando unit gets trapped in the jungle by a murderous, seemingly invincible alien hunter. But they ain't got time to bleed.

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: (1993) Brian De Palma's crime thriller with Al Pacino. An ex-con, fresh out of jail, flamboyantly declares his plan to go straight. But his criminal past just won't let him go. Adults only.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: (2010) Comedy adventure. Jack Black stars as the would-be travel writer Lemuel Gulliver, who gets stranded on an island of tiny people in this updating of Jonathan Swift's classic novel.

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
programme.desc: (2003) Family comedy with Mike Myers. A badly behaved boy and his super-organised sister are plunged into an anarchic adventure when a man-sized talking cat suddenly appears at their home.

programme.title: The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: (2011) Steven Spielberg's animated adventure. When young reporter Tintin buys a beautiful model ship from a Belgian street market, it leads to a dangerous international treasure hunt.

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: (2003) Jack Black cranks the comedy up to 11. A slacker rock musician blags his way into a posh school and enrols a bunch of 10-year-olds into a full-scale Battle of the Bands.

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: (2022) Michael Bay's high-octane thriller with Jake Gyllenhaal. A bodged heist sees two brothers try to evade the LAPD in a hospital wagon, as a paramedic operates on a cop in the back.

programme.title: Little Monsters
programme.desc: (2019) Undead comedy horror with Lupita Nyong'o. Can an infantile slacker, a diligent teacher and a deranged children's TV presenter rescue a school trip from a zombie outbreak? Head count!

programme.title: Stand By Me
programme.desc: (1986) Four young friends (Wil Wheaton, River Phoenix, Corey Feldman, Jerry O'Connell) set out on an expedition into deepest Oregon in this coming-of-age tale based on a Stephen King story.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: (1996) Comedy starring Faye Dunaway and Rupert Everett. A hotel owner's attempt to upgrade her star rating is undermined by the arrival of a master thief and his light-fingered orangutan.

programme.title: The War with Grandpa
programme.desc: (2020) Raucous family comedy starring Robert De Niro, Uma Thurman and Oakes Fegley. A grandpa gets embroiled in a prank war with his grandson when he moves into the family home.

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: (1992) Comedy starring Whoopi Goldberg. A casino singer who witnesses a Mob murder goes into hiding at a convent, where she soon has the choir rocking. With Maggie Smith.

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: (2006) Comedy-drama starring Anne Hathaway and Meryl Streep. A naive young woman lands a job as assistant to one of New York's most important, but ruthless and cynical, magazine editors.

programme.title: The Greatest Showman
programme.desc: (2017) Hugh Jackman, Zac Efron and Michelle Williams star in the Golden-Globe-winning, toe-tapping smash hit musical about the life and times of P.T. Barnum, the creator of the circus.

programme.title: The King's Man
programme.desc: (2021) The spy-caper franchise continues with the origins story of the Kingsman agency, as a plucky group battle an international conspiracy at the outbreak of WWI. With Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: (2018) Tense horror starring John Krasinski and Emily Blunt. A family struggle to survive when the world's overrun by vicious blind aliens who can hear even the slightest whimper.

programme.title: In Bruges
programme.desc: (2008) Comedy-drama. Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson star as Irish hitmen who are banished to Belgium by their boss after they botch a job. With Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy starring Robin Williams and Sally Field. A struggling actor dresses as a woman to get his estranged wife to hire him as a housekeeper, so he can spend more time with his kids.

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: (2010) Family fantasy comedy. Dwayne Johnson stars as a tough ice hockey player who is transformed into a real-life fairy as punishment for telling a child that tooth fairies don't exist.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: (2011) The third movie in the sci-fi action franchise. The discovery of a spacecraft on the dark side of the moon sparks another battle between the Autobots and the Decepticons.

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: (2009) JJ Abrams's sci-fi adventure reboot, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Zoe Saldana. A vengeful time traveller targets Kirk and Spock on their first mission.

programme.title: Honest Thief
programme.desc: (2020) Action thriller starring Liam Neeson as a notorious bank robber. He wants to give it all up for love but is cheated by corrupt FBI agents. Can he clear his name and get the girl?

programme.title: A Quiet Place Part II
programme.desc: (2020) Hushed-horror sequel with Emily Blunt and Cillian Murphy. Armed only with a hearing aid, can the family evade the vicious aliens with super-hearing, and find a community to live in?

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: (2022) It's Predator, 1719 style. Amber Midthunder stars as a Comanche hunter who must save her tribe from an extraterrestrial threat in this action prequel. If it bleeds, you can kill it.

programme.desc: (1987) Sci-fi thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. A US commando unit gets trapped in the jungle by a murderous, seemingly invincible alien hunter. But they ain't got time to bleed.

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: (2022) Michael Bay's high-octane thriller with Jake Gyllenhaal. A bodged heist sees two brothers try to evade the LAPD in a hospital wagon, as a paramedic operates on a cop in the back.

programme.title: Little Monsters
programme.desc: (2019) Undead comedy horror with Lupita Nyong'o. Can an infantile slacker, a diligent teacher and a deranged children's TV presenter rescue a school trip from a zombie outbreak? Head count!

programme.desc: (1986) Four young friends (Wil Wheaton, River Phoenix, Corey Feldman, Jerry O'Connell) set out on an expedition into deepest Oregon in this coming-of-age tale based on a Stephen King story.

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: Crime thriller based on the hit US TV series, starring Denzel Washington. On the face of it, Robert McCall is just an ordinary guy who works at a DIY store and leads a quiet life. But when McCall befriends a young girl controlled by ruthless Russian gangsters, he's unable to stand idly by and resorts to using skills from his shady former career.

programme.title: You Bet!
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host the second of two editions of a reboot of the game show, which sees contestants face extraordinary challenges for the chance to win ¬£10,000. A panel of celebrities, led by Rob Beckett and featuring Olly Murs, Mary Earps and Judi Love, and the studio audience must predict if each challenger can complete the task with which they are faced

programme.title: In for a Penny: Christmas Crackers
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern presents a Christmas edition of the game show, surprising unsuspecting members of the public across the UK with his ridiculous games. Highlights include a festive Weigh to Go and a hilarious Get Your Skates On, while viewers are asked to identify the mystery Celebrity Santa Claus in Santa Who Who Who. Plus, players get absolutely covered in gravy as they attempt to win ¬£1,000

programme.title: Shrek the Halls
programme.desc: Festive animated short featuring the full whimsical cast of the hit film series. Shrek settles down for a quiet Christmas with Fiona and the babies, but Donkey and the ogre's other friends have their own ideas - and the party soon descends into chaos. Featuring the voices of Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz and Antonio Banderas

programme.title: It's a Wonderful Life
programme.desc: Frank Capra's classic fantasy drama, starring James Stewart, Donna Reed and Lionel Barrymore. George Bailey is a small-town businessman who believes he has been a failure. Contemplating suicide, George meets his guardian angel and discovers what life in his home town of Bedford Falls would have been like had he never lived.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: April continues to push boundaries, Belle considers visiting Tom, and Ruby steels herself for a difficult Christmas Day

programme.title: Royal Carols: Together at Christmas
programme.desc: The Princess of Wales hosts a special Christmas carol service at Westminster Abbey, supported by The Royal Foundation, to recognise and celebrate the incredible work of individuals and organisations across the nation who have stepped up to support their communities

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey hopes that a last-minute revelation will stop Gail from leaving, Debbie feeds David's suspicions of Shona, and Leanne makes a serious allegation against Nick and Toyah

programme.title: TikTok: Top 100 2024
programme.desc: A countdown of the top 100 funniest, most extreme and rudest viral videos of 2024 from TikTok and other social media platforms. Plus, an estimation of how much money the clips made for their creators

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Christmas Carols on ITV
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter Louise Redknapp hosts a Christmas Eve celebration from St Elisabeth's Church in Greater Manchester. programme.title: Martin Lewis: How to Win at Board Games

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Christmas Special

programme.title: Downton Abbey: A New Era
programme.desc: Period drama sequel starring Hugh Bonneville, Elizabeth McGovern and Maggie Smith. It's 1928, and Downton Abbey has been chosen as the setting for a new silent film, much to the excitement of the staff. Meanwhile, the Crawleys set off for the South of France, where the Dowager Countess is set to come into possession of a glamorous villa.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance 2024
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr host the gala evening at the Royal Albert Hall, in the presence of King Charles. programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September of this year, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the King George VI Chase from Kempton Park. Plus, the Rowland Meyrick Chase from Wetherby and the Formby Hurdle from Aintree. With analysis from AP McCoy, Mick Fitzgerald and Ruby Walsh, reports from Matt Chapman and Sally Ann Grassick, and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Musical based on the hit stage show, starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John. Unexpectedly reunited with summer love Danny at her new high school, Sandy Olsson can't believe how different he is. Can the new Danny Zuko, the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-birds, really be the boy she met down at the beach? Perhaps Frenchy and Rizzo, both members of the super-cool Pink Ladies gang, can help her develop some street cred to win back his heart.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Festive edition of Lee Mack's quiz, in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Bruce Willis. When a rogue former government agent threatens to bring the United States computer infrastructure to its knees, it falls to cop John McClane and a young hacker to prevent potential disaster. But can the mix of old-school, tough-guy policing and modern computer expertise foil a group that will stop at nothing?

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: Crime thriller based on the hit US TV series, starring Denzel Washington. On the face of it, Robert McCall is just an ordinary guy who works at a DIY store and leads a quiet life. But when McCall befriends a young girl controlled by ruthless Russian gangsters, he's unable to stand idly by and resorts to using skills from his shady former career.

programme.title: You Bet!
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host the second of two editions of a reboot of the game show, which sees contestants face extraordinary challenges for the chance to win ¬£10,000. A panel of celebrities, led by Rob Beckett and featuring Olly Murs, Mary Earps and Judi Love, and the studio audience must predict if each challenger can complete the task with which they are faced

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as actor Tony Maudsley, Olympic trampoline champion Bryony Page, actress Kerry Godliman and Pointless presenter Alexander Armstrong take on one of Britain's finest quizzing brains, hoping to win money for their chosen charities. programme.title: Downton Abbey: A New Era
programme.desc: Period drama sequel starring Hugh Bonneville, Elizabeth McGovern and Maggie Smith. Meanwhile, the Crawleys set off for the South of France, where the Dowager Countess is set to come into possession of a glamorous villa.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Dame Maggie Smith: A Celebration
programme.desc: A tribute to the celebrated and enigmatic actress, with her life story told by those who knew her best, celebrating her much-loved appearances across film and TV spanning almost 70 years. Smith, who died in September of this year, had gained a new level of popularity playing the razor-tongued Lady Violet Crawley in Downton Abbey, but for all her success, remained a very private person who had little time for the trappings that came with fame. The film tells the story of a girl born in pre-war Essex who, against the odds, took Broadway and the West End by storm before eventually becoming one of the world's most popular and respected performers

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Musical based on the hit stage show, starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John. Unexpectedly reunited with summer love Danny at her new high school, Sandy Olsson can't believe how different he is.
